titleStmt.title: W. J. Simmons to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6639

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Williamstown
MayJune 1st 1865
Hon Thomas E Bramlet
Governor of Kentucky

G R Scott was arrested here yesterday for Peddling without Licens & was fined by judge Burnett $50. & Costs -- He had no money & the goods with him is worth nothing & he a total stranger & is now in jail -- will you please remit the fine -- I am the Atty for the county & will cheerfully receipt to him for my percent without receiving a cent -- Judge Burnett who tried the man approves the effort for his discharge I will send this by E H Smith Esqr who will explain more fully.

Your Obt Servt
W. T. Simmons

County Court
Grant Co
vs
G. R. Scott
$50.
Remitted 3D June/65
